normalised: Hey everyone! Ever wondered what makes a video of a cat playing tabla go viral faster than you can say "Jai Hind"? normalised: Another key trend we’re seeing is the rise of micro-influencers. Instead of chasing after folks with millions of followers, brands are partnering with influencers who have smaller, more engaged audiences. For example, a local saree shop in Varanasi might see more success working with a fashion blogger with five thousand followers who specifically targets handloom enthusiasts, rather than a Bollywood celebrity endorsing everything under the sun. Makes sense, right?
